headline: Melt-in-Your-Mouth Shortbread
description: This is the best shortbread recipe ever, and it's so easy to make with 4 simple pantry ingredients that combine to make a decadent, buttery treat.

video.description: These shortbread cookies are simple yet elegant, and make a great gift.
video.name: Melt-in-Your-Mouth Shortbread

name: Melt-in-Your-Mouth Shortbread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Beat butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add flour, confectioners' sugar, and cornstarch; beat on low for 1 minute, then high for 3 to 4 minutes. Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, 12 to 15 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic! I used a rolling pin and cookie-cutter for my batches. Sometimes, I will add one-half teaspoon of (real) vanilla for additional flavor.
yummy. Easy, fast & good.

I've been using this exact recipe for years now and as usual... Perfectamundo!!! My children love them. Once they come out of the oven I let cool for maybe 2 minutes, then sprinkle confectioners sugar onto them and a maraschino half cherry. My family loves them!!!!

I think this is a fast and simple recipe. I do add a little twist by adding a lemon zest into the batter, then using some of the lemon juice to make a royal icing to drizzel. These cookies melt in your mouth.

This recipe FAILED, first there was not enough butter to make batter. I added more butter twice. Tried to cook it and it turned into a cake not cookies. Tasted like sweet fat. I will not try this one again.

Excellent melt in your mouth & not too sweet. Love this.
Excellent

I made these exactly the way the instructions read. They look pretty and smell amazing. But, they taste and feel like eating chalk. It has a very small hint of a taste of shortbread. (Don't chew, you might miss it)

I make it a LOT! So quick and easy. This year I added Andes Peppermint Crunch Baking Chips and WOWZA! an new favorite was born!
I added a bit of desiccated coconut to half of the batter. This recipe was easy to use.
Love it. Very tasty

>Recipe Is So Easy To Follow
>Ingredients Mixed With No Issues 
>Cookies Browned Beautifully
>Cookies Slide Off Pan Perfectly
>Simply D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S

*The Final Test> Hubby enjoyed eating them and so did I :)Thank You So Much for My New Favorites Addition.

I made half the recipe it was very good! They do really melt in your mouth! I was a bit adventurous and decided to use my cookie press and it was just fine despite the few hiccups I had. I had never made cookie press cookies, so to be the first time they came out really pretty and tasty. They are airy. My only modification would be to next time use a bit less salt, but that is just my preference. Will make it again to get a hang of the cookie press and practice. They make the perfect holiday gift. They reminded me or the Royal Dansk cookies, but these taste a lot better so buttery.

I have made used this recipe since Christmas at least 10 times and it is winner! My family loves the melt in your mouth texture. I follow the recipe to a tee, the tips about blending on high for 3 to 4 minutes does make a difference. Thanks for sharing

This recipe is super easy. I pressed guava paste into the centers before cookie, adding that flavor reminds me of the Hawaii. The family LOVED these. 
As others stated the cookies crumble easily when first out of the oven. In order to prevent them from breaking I cooked them on parchment paper and slid the whole paper to the cooling racks. Once they cool they are still somewhat delicate, you must pack in a box if transporting anywhere. They are likely to crumble in ziploc bags.
It’s soo good!!

So my kids friends were visiting them in Toronto on Christmas Day and asked me if I wanted to send something. I decided to send the cookies. I list my keeper and decided to go for this one. What else to say! Loved by family and friends. I will not say they ‘melt in mouth’ but they are just yummy. It’s going to be a keeper after losing my original recipe. Thank you for sharing.
I added 1/4 c of ground 1/4 c pecans for a little extra flavor and it was great.
Substituted 1/4 cup cornstarch with 1/2 cup tapioca starch, added 1tsp vanilla, and baked at 350 degrees for 9 minutes. They came out perfect!
Loved it. Super easy and quick

Fantastic cookies. I have in the past whipped the butter way longer and the flour etc afterwards in other shortbread recipes so I was a bit leery with this recipe. But it turned out just fine! I also added some cherries on top before baking. Not sure why some have said they are tasteless, they definitely are not. Or that they are to crumbly, again not at all. Maybe some just need some cooking lessons ?? I'd make these again in a heartbeat!

Really easy and yummy cookie! I did use a cookie press tho, and I probably should have chilled the dough first as the cookie lost a lot of definition while baking. Still delicious, I just told people my kids helped. They went fast in the cookie exchange.

This is one of my go to recipes for bringing to holiday gatherings. I add some vanilla to the original recipe...everything is better with vanilla! Then drizzle a buttercream icing on top and add seasonal sprinkles! The light texture of the cookie with the heavier, rich butter cream is amazing together!
Great recipe! I recommend adding a splash of vanilla extract for optimal flavor

These cookies are the best! The only tip I have to add is to make them with salted butter. I've made them with both salted and unsalted and found them to taste better when made with salted. I also melt some semi sweet chocolate and half dip them once they're cooled. I was super proud of myself after making these and think I'm going to make up little boxes of these to give to family and friends as gifts at Christmas this year!
Very light and crispy. Not too sweet.

I used a cookie dough scooper for half the dough, and their form hadn’t changed at all while baking. The second half I rolled into a log, covered in sprinkles, and sliced. Both sets were wonderful!

First time through, I made it exactly as written - very dry and fell apart, very crumbly. Second time through, I added a bit of milk and some vanilla for some flavor. Whipped the butter for several minutes - still had problems. Very dry. I think the taste is there, but I couldn't eat one without it crumbling - "exploding" as my 16yo son said. Off to look for a different shortbread cookie recipe.
These were truly melt in your mouth! Delish!

They were the best shortbread ever. Just dissolve on your

Definitely "melt in your mouth"! We added an icing drizzle and everyone loved it.

I will likely make them again. They are really great ! My husband likes them too !
The dough had to be worked a bit by hand. It was easy to work with and wasnt to dry. They turned out good but I think I"ll try a different recipe next time.

I make this every year and they are always a hit. It’s good with either salted or unsalted butter. It’s 50/50 split in my family preference on the butter. I recommend to make a batch with each salted and unsalted then decide. I use a 1M Wilton tip for piping. Make sure to whip for at least 7 mins on high so piping is a breeze. I use parchment paper when baking so the cookies slide easily onto cooling rack.
Like my mom used to make! LOVE THESE
Help I followed the receipe but the batter was like grease I melted the butter in the microwave and I followed the rest of the receipe. What did I do wrong? Rosalind

Love this! Made these since I was a young girl!

I even sprinkled some icing sugar on top to attempt to “save” the cookies as they had zero flavour while they were still warm. Nothing. To add to this review my GF and myself utilize Allrecipes constantly as our “Go To” place as virtually no fail. Obviously in this case , in our opinion these shortbread fall way , way SHORT!!

Amazing I was a bit sceptical at first but it was amazing!
I found baking at 375 for the length of time it calls for too much, the heat starts to burn the edges before the center is fully done. 350 for 10-12 minutes on my stove seemed to work great. Definitely know your stove and I suggest standing by them while they bake to keep a eye on them. 
But honestly amazing. After I made the first batch I made 2 more! 1 more for my family and another for a friend. Perfect for holidays .

This recipe yielded 32 cookies using my #2070 scoop, I baked at 350 for 14 minutes, turning pans halfway through, I used 4 of each red and green glace cherries quartered to decorate the tops. Thanks!

I wish I could give it more stars. These were AMAZING!!! I loved them and so did mom and my boyfriend. They both were shocked that I made them.
Made exactly as shown in video. Except that I only had salted Mimosa butter and by mistake melted it so had to keep it beating for 30 mins or so to see it turn white and flufier. Still worked out perfectly.
These are AWESOME. They can be dressed up with a little drizzle, but great with out.
Amazing is what these cookies are! Melt in your mouth is literally what they do! Will definetly be making these again.]
